title: I can play 1000 more games against a zed, and still not understand how to beat him
body:
First off he builds hex and suddenly most mages lose to him
Any jungler with a brain can gank him multiple times and pretty much guarantee kills.
He just seems so braindead for someone who is supposed to be countered by range

replies.body:
The main thing i would say (from a zed main point of view) dont get poked out, as zed its difficult to get anything done if you cant consistently poke in laning phase. If zed cant poke you then he cant exactly shove the lane atleast without taking decent dmg and he most certainly cant kill you in one combo unless he is almost a full item ahead of you.

Also remember that lethality is kinda useless if you build armor, so build ninja tabis and zhonyas and he wont be able to one shot you without a ton of counterplay.

Remember where he puts his shadows (i cant tell you how many times ive gotten free kills because people forget)

Most mages outscale zed and are designed to be team fight champs, so play to your strengths and dont play super aggro in lane just wait and outscale.

Check out his cds on his w and try to get a feel for when it will be back up, he always has to make a decision between mobility, wave clear, or poke (some might overlap) but basically its a long cd and he cant do much without it so fight him when its on cd and back off when its off cd.

Im not going to argue, because for the most part everything you said was either just flat out wrong or was fueled by your bias against zed.

I just want to point out some logic errors. If you consider energy to be a limitless resource then so is mana, since both can eventually be fully regenerated. Also buying {{item:3155}}  puts zed just as far behind maybe even further behind than a mage buying {{item:3191}}  since for one maw is incredibly bad and relatively useless while zhonyas is almost a standard item for mages whether your going against an assassin or not, the only downside is that you have to build it slightly earlier. Zed can only really poke or all in with his w which during laning phase has about a 15 sec cd, so he can definitely be poked out, considering most mages have shorter cds on their poke and the have the same if not more range. Poking zed out and not going ham are completly different things and is most certainly not a contradictory tip. Have a good day.

play a bruiser/tank mid who can shove and bring {{summoner:3}} ez pz 

{{champion:86}} {{champion:122}} both work really well into him and garen can roam easy. Sometimes you just have to play outside the box.

Also countering Zed regards some knowledge on how the Zed players position. To be more specific, you mustn't position yourself between him or his shadows as all of his damage comes from multiple Razor Shurikens landing while his Death Mark is on you. Any other damage such as Duskblade procs, Electrocute or Dark Harvest procs, are all supplemental but the main portion of the damage that "fills" his Death mark is from his Q. 

Really if you can flash or dash away from his shadows then you've pretty much countered his ulti.

And if you're running Zhonya's you really just want to enter stasis after he puts Death Mark on you. The damage comes from the damage he stacks until it pops. So if you don't let him stack up the damage before the pop, the pop does like a basic attacks worth of damage. And generally inbetween the time it takes to reveal himself, ulti, wait for stasis to time out, 5 or such seconds would have already been passed and Duskblade can no longer proc and therefore preventing him from stacking even more damage for his Death Mark.
